published Prodromus astronomiae (1690), their jointly compiled catalogue of
1,564 stars and their positions.

She is considered one of the first female astronomers, and called "the mother of
moon charts". Her life was recently novelized as The Star Huntress (2006).

The minor planet 12625 Koopman is named in her honour, as is the crater
Corpman on Venus.
